topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552c70796368720ebb160800#post_552c70796368720ebb160800
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]It took Wolf Children nine and a half minutes to do something Twilight couldn't do in in four books and five movies.
[/bq]
What do you mean by this?
Realistic characters with emotions?
Likable boyfriend and girlfriend characters that get together?
Well fleshed out story?
Realistic reason why the boyfriend doesn't tell anyone?
Healthy relationship?
Characters with actual emotions?
Actual story conflict that is actually important?
A story conflict that isn't settled by droopy eyes?
. . . Five hours later. . .
Children characters that are actually indicative of real life children?
Non-abusive relationship?
. . . Ten hours later. . .
Teenagers that have actual conflict with choosing their future for themselves?
. . . so much later that the previous narrator quit and started a family. . .
Teenager girl faces actual conflict with trying to lead a normal life?

Or all of the above?
